alert.note: Alert for Inland Martin; Inland St. Lucie; Okeechobee (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 3:05PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western St. Lucie, southeastern Okeechobee and western Martin Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 304 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles west of Fort Pierce South to 7 miles west of Palm City. Movement was southwest at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Indiantown, J And S Fish Camp, Tradition, Saint Lucie West and First Data Field. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!

area.areaDesc: Inland Martin; Inland St. Lucie; Okeechobee
